section.title: Net Primary Productivity
section.para: We measured aboveground biomass on two dates, one month apart, by harvesting all live and senesced vegetation and litter within a designated harvest area. The greater of two harvests for each treatment is considered peak aboveground biomass. For below ground biomass, three 22 mm soil cores to 15 cm were taken within the aboveground harvest area, two days after the first aboveground harvest. Soils were wet sieved through 0.5mm mesh. Live roots were separated from dead. We did not account for additional NPP in root turnover, which, based on other studies at this site, may increase annual root production by 44-54 percentage.

description.para: We estimated NPP as peak biomass (above- and below-ground) in the late spring (April)in the years 1998, 1999, 2000, 2001, 2002 and 2003.

samplingDescription.para: The Jasper Ridge Global Change Experiment (JRGCE) manipulates four global change factors: CO2 (ambient and 680 ppm), temperature (ambient and ambient plus 80 W m-2 of thermal radiation), precipitation (ambient and 50 percent above ambient 3 week growing season elongation), and nitrogen deposition (ambient and ambient plus 7g N m-2 y-1) in a complete factorial design. The JRGCE, initiated in 1998, includes 8 replicates of each of the 16 treatments. These are organized as a split-plot design with 32 circular plots, each divided into four 0.78m2 quadrants, separated by solid belowground and mesh aboveground partitions.
